description: By analogy with monopoly, from the Latin-derived prefix duo- and the Greek-derived suffix -poly. From duo- +â€Ž -poly.

entries.meaning: (economics) A market situation in which two companies exclusively provide a particular product or service.
(by extension) The domination of a field of endeavor by two people or entities.
(broadcasting, by extension) Situation in which two or more TV or radio-stations in the same city or community share common ownership.
